intro: Notodontia micrantha, commonly known as the small-leaf notodontid, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related plants. The plant is characterized by its small, simple leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It produces a milky sap, which is a common feature among members of its family. Notodontia micrantha is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
